events.name: Getting Started with Kubernetes
events.description:
In 2018 Kubernetes is emerging as the de facto choice for managing containerised applications. All the big cloud providers are including it as a service and many great applications and extensions are being built on top of Kubernetes.

Agenda:
19:00 - 20:00 Introduction to Kubernetes - Basic concepts and use cases.

20:00 - 21:00 Hands on Demo

21:00 + Networking

events.name: Kubernetes Workshop 2
events.description:
We’re going to explore various solutions with Kubernetes in Google Cloud. This is going to be a hands-on session so make sure you have your laptop with you.
The labs are self paced, suitable for all levels.

Victor Gradinescu is the cofounder of Mobile Kinetics, a Mobile and Cloud Development Agency. He writes code for Android but also architects and develops cloud based solutions.

events.name: Cloud Next Extended
events.description:
We will go through in-depth summaries of some of the topics covered at Google Cloud Next '18 London. Topics will include:
- Cloud IoT Core & Cloud IoT Edge
- Kubernetes & Serverless
- BigQuery ML
- Data Engineering in Google Cloud

The speakers will be:
- Bogdan Lucaciu - Chief Technology Officer at Adore Me
- Cosmin Stefan - Co-founder and Software Engineer at Silverbit Tech
- Victor Gradinescu - Co-founder and Software Engineer at Mobile Kinetics

Please note that we will host this meetup at the Adore Me office near Cismigiu.

events.name: Spring Meetup - Containers and Serverless
events.description:
We meet again in this first meetup of the Spring to discuss two very interesting topics with two experienced engineers.

Agenda:
"Care and use of container orchestration systems" - Andrei Dragomir, Fitbit Romania

Let’s talk about why people go from “docker run” to Heroku dynos, and ways of solving this problem. We’ll talk about Mesos, Kubernetes, how container orchestration systems work, why you should use them, and especially, why you shouldn’t !
Andrei has experience with distributed systems. He worked on distributed data processing systems and migrating these services across 2 cloud providers, moving from bare metal to containerized infrastructures. Since 2017, he’s wrangling microservices @ Fitbit.

"Serving users without servers" - Felix Crisan, co-founder Netopia & MobilPay

This will be about developing serverless solutions on top of Google Cloud Functions.
When not dedicating his time to the two ventures, Felix teaches BigData concepts and technologies, including Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence algorithms.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam #1 - IoT
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for a Cloud Study Jam focusing on the IoT solutions based on Google Cloud Platform.
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want
Bring your own laptop as this will be a hands on experience. The labs will run in the browser so no additional software needs to be installed.

organizers.name: Victor G.
organizers.bio: I am a co-organiser of GDG Bucharest and have been involved in the tech community for over four years. In 2011 I co-founded Mobile Kinetics where my team focuses on native mobile applications on all major platforms, consumer or enterprise oriented.

group_profile.intro: Founder of Mobile Kinetics - a mobile & cloud development agency.
